Posts.Content: May 12, 2011 01:20AM MissTW wrote: My heart goes out to that poor woman. I feel she was discriminated against due to her cancer diagnosis. What about individuals with different health issues, should they have their children taken away? How scary! I am recently divorced as well. Fortunately for me my children are teenagers but I often wondered what would of happened  if my ex made as issue of my past  colon cancer  and recent breast cancer diagnosis. Let's hope this decision is reversed for this woman, hasn't she had enough stress and pain!
Posts.Title: Stage IV mom loses custody of children judyfams agada

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2010 04:37PM MissTW wrote: I am having a lumpectomy, breast reduction and 4 weeks of radiation. My pathology report read "Suspicious for ductal carcinoma". Of course my lymph nodes need to be examined for cancer. In 2007 I had stage 3 colon cancer and doctors were confident it wasn't in my lymph nodes but it was in one. Surgery is scheduled in early october.My surgeon was very informative and explained all in great detail. I am cautiously optimistic.
Posts.Title: Dr. Swistel Cornell Weil MissTW MissTW

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2011 05:57AM - edited Jan 24, 2011 05:58AM by MissTW Got my Oncotype score last week, 22 low intermediate. My Onc said that since I had NO vascular involvment he would not recommend chemo. In my case it would do more harm than good. Since I am er+/pr+ and HER negative he recommended 5 years of Tamoxifen. Diagnosed with ILC, small tumor, o nodes. Good luck to you!
Posts.Title: Anyone with an intermediate oncotype? Lovelillian nem126

Posts.Content: MissTW wrote: I have an appointment this Wed., with Top NYC Breast Oncology Surgeon Alexander Swistel. Does anyone have any knowledge or experience with this physician? I am so excited and thrilled, I thought I would need to wait another month or two for an appointment.  What questions should I ask? I will be alone so I need to be prepared. Also, can I have an MRI if I have titanium staples in my colon and I hear the metal marker in my breast is titanium also? Please pray for me as I need to be her for my daughters! God is great! Stage 1 ILC/LCIS er+/pr+ HER - 27 rads, grade 2, 0 Nodes NO CHEMO, ONCOTYPE SCORE 22 Colon Cancer Survivor STage 3, 5FU, Oxilaplatin/Leucovorin Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Dr. Swistel Cornell Weil MissTW MissTW

Posts.Content: MissTW wrote: I have a 9mm mass, low grade carcinoma. I was so fortunate to get an appointment with one of the top surgeons in Manahattan. I am scheduled for an MRI on Tuesday. Can someone tell me what to expect, I dislike closed spaces. The plan is as follows:Lumpectomy, having 4 weeks of radiation and a breast reduction and lift. Sentinel node will be checked, doc feels it has been caught early and he would be surprised if there are any cancer cells present. I was so sure I wanted both breast removed but after consulting on this forum and speaking to the doctor I realized I was overreacting. What should I expect after surgery and how much time should I take off from work? Thank you! Stage 1 ILC/LCIS er+/pr+ HER - 27 rads, grade 2, 0 Nodes NO CHEMO, ONCOTYPE SCORE 22 Colon Cancer Survivor STage 3, 5FU, Oxilaplatin/Leucovorin Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed/Surgery MissTW Lovegolf

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2011 05:35PM - edited Mar 29, 2011 05:37PM by MissTW I think what you are feeling is normal as well as your husband's reaction. You are blessed to have a wonderful husband/marriage who is there for you. It touches my heart to read messages from spouses. I wasn't so fortunate, my ex left me and our daughter's during my first stage 3 cancer diagnosis in 2007. On the day of my divorce this past year I came home to receive a message from my breast surgeon to hear "you have cancer". I am not complaining, I am fortunate to have my children and I feel great! Stay positive and strong! Stay strong and be well!

Stay strong for your children.
